metadata.name: Crepuscular rays
metadata.description:
Crepuscular rays are sunbeams that originate when the sun is just below the horizon, during twilight hours. The rays are visible only when the atmosphere contains enough haze or dust particles so that sunlight in unshadowed areas can be scattered toward the observer. This photo was taken from Gargash Peak, Iranian National Observatory (INO) has been built on top of This peak at an altitude of 3600m above sea level.  Kashan city in Isfahan province, Iran.
